fields.title: Harris 1990 Public Opinion Survey, study no. 901105

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: This survey focuses on a variety of topics including a rating of President Bush and his handling of the Iraqi Middle East crisis, oil companies, and anti-Arab feeling.

fields.notesText: Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: Harris telephone surveys use a form of random digit dialing. From a random multi-stage cluster sampling design, they obtain a national cross-section of U.S. adults. Interviewers are usually given the first five digits of a series of randomly selected residential telephone geographic locations, including minor civil divisions. The interviewer then adds two randomly generated digits to complete a new seven-digit number.; Subject: null  Type: ODUM:ACCESS.CATEGORY  Notes: I; Subject: null  Type: ODUM:CODEBOOK.NUMBER  Notes: H-901105;
